metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37454 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 6.4.2. A crafted UDF filesystem image causes a use-after-free write operation in the udf_put_super and udf_close_lvid functions in fs/udf/super.c. NOTE: the suse.com reference has a different perspective about this.

notes.Note: sbeattie> according to upstream, this is syzkaller corrupting a mounted loopback device by writing directly to the device while it's mounted. Upstream is unlikely to fix this, other than by having the fuzzer not do that.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
